abstract: Xinjiang Goldwind, the Chinese alternative energy company, said Monday that it had decided to cancel its $1.2 billion initial public offering because of “unexpected and excessive market volatility.”
snippet: Xinjiang Goldwind, the Chinese alternative energy company, said Monday that it had decided to cancel its $1.2 billion initial public offering because of “unexpected and excessive market volatility.”
lead_paragraph: Xinjiang Goldwind, the Chinese alternative energy company, said Monday that it had decided to cancel its $1.2 billion initial public offering because of “unexpected and excessive market volatility.”

headline.main: Xinjiang Goldwind Cancels Hong Kong I.P.O.
